services.name: AI-Powered Medication Adherence Monitor
services.overview: The AI-Powered Medication Adherence Monitor is a comprehensive system designed to improve medication adherence among patients, particularly seniors and those with chronic conditions. It leverages computer vision and voice recognition technologies integrated into a smart home device and mobile application to ensure medications are taken correctly and on time. The system observes patients during medication intake, provides voice prompts and reminders, analyzes the actions using AI, and generates detailed adherence reports. Discrepancies or missed doses trigger alerts to caregivers, enabling timely intervention and improved care management. This solution aims to reduce hospital readmissions, improve patient health outcomes, and lower overall healthcare costs by addressing the critical issue of medication non-adherence.  The smart home device will use edge computing to process the video feed, while the mobile application provides a user-friendly interface for patients, caregivers, and healthcare providers to track adherence and manage medication schedules. Secure data transmission and storage are paramount, complying with all relevant healthcare regulations.  The system also incorporates machine learning models to personalize reminders and optimize the timing of prompts based on individual patient behavior.  This personalized approach ensures that reminders are effective without being intrusive, fostering better adherence habits.  The system is designed to seamlessly integrate with existing healthcare systems, such as electronic health records (EHRs) and pharmacy databases, to provide a holistic view of patient medication management.
problems_addressed: High rates of medication non-adherence among elderly and chronically ill patients.
Adverse health outcomes and increased hospital readmissions due to incorrect medication intake.
Lack of real-time monitoring and reporting of medication adherence for caregivers and healthcare providers.
target_users: Patients with chronic conditions requiring multiple medications.
Caregivers (family members, home healthcare agencies) responsible for medication management.
Healthcare providers (doctors, pharmacists) seeking to improve patient adherence and treatment outcomes.
core_features: Computer Vision Analysis – Real-time analysis of medication intake to identify the medication, dosage, and timing using object recognition and action detection models.
Voice Prompts and Reminders – Customizable voice reminders to prompt patients to take their medication on schedule, with escalating reminders if a dose is missed.
Mobile App Interface – User-friendly mobile app for patients, caregivers, and healthcare providers to view adherence reports, manage medication schedules, and receive alerts.
Caregiver Alerts – Automated alerts sent to caregivers via SMS, email, or in-app notifications when a patient misses a dose or takes medication incorrectly.
Adherence Reporting – Detailed reports on medication adherence, including the time, date, and type of medication taken, accessible via the mobile app and a secure web portal.
Medication Identification - Capability to identify medications by visual analysis of pills, capsules, and packaging to prevent errors.
Secure Data Storage and Transmission - HIPAA-compliant data storage and transmission to ensure patient privacy and data security.
user_journeys: Patient logs into the mobile app and sets up their medication schedule, including medication names, dosages, and timing.  The patient places their medication within view of the smart home device's camera.  When the scheduled time arrives, the device provides a voice prompt reminding the patient to take their medication.  The patient takes the medication, and the camera records the action.  The AI analyzes the video to verify the medication, dosage, and timing.  The system records the adherence event and updates the adherence report. If a dose is missed, the device provides escalating reminders, and if still missed, an alert is sent to the caregiver.
ai_capabilities: Object Detection (Computer Vision) – Utilizes a pre-trained or fine-tuned object detection model (e.g., YOLOv8, SSD) to identify medication containers, pills, and capsules.  The model must be trained on a diverse dataset of medication images to ensure accurate identification across different brands and packaging.

Action Recognition (Computer Vision) – Employs an action recognition model (e.g., TimeSformer, VideoBERT) to analyze patient actions during medication intake, such as picking up the medication, opening the container, and swallowing the medication.  The model will determine if the correct action (taking medication) is performed.
Voice Recognition (NLP) – Integrates a speech-to-text engine (e.g., Google Cloud Speech-to-Text, AssemblyAI) to process patient responses to voice prompts and confirm medication intake.

Anomaly Detection (ML) – Implements an anomaly detection algorithm (e.g., Isolation Forest, One-Class SVM) to identify deviations from the patient's typical medication intake behavior, such as taking the wrong medication or skipping a dose. Fine-tuning considerations: The object detection model should be fine-tuned on a dataset of prescription drugs in the target user's area. The action recognition model needs to be trained with video clips of people taking medication. Embeddings: Medication names can be embedded for similarity search. Vector Search: If the system grows to include many users, vector search can be used to identify potential adverse events based on similar medication combinations.

input_data_types: Video feed from the smart home device camera.
Audio recordings of patient responses to voice prompts.
Patient medication schedules (medication name, dosage, timing).
Patient demographics and medical history (optional, for personalized reminders).
data_schema_recommendations: Table: Patients - patient_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), name (VARCHAR), dob (DATE), medication_schedule (JSONB).
Table: Medications - medication_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), name (VARCHAR), dosage (VARCHAR), image_embeddings (VECTOR).

Table: Adherence_Events - event_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), patient_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), medication_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), timestamp (TIMESTAMP), adherence_status (BOOLEAN), video_url (VARCHAR), audio_url (VARCHAR).
data_sources: Microphone on the smart home device.
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: HIPAA compliance is mandatory.  Data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.  Access controls must be implemented to restrict access to patient data.  Patients must provide explicit consent for data collection and usage.  Regular audits should be conducted to ensure compliance.  Consider obtaining SOC 2 certification.

required_integrations: Twilio or similar SMS provider for sending caregiver alerts.
Email provider (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) for sending email notifications.
Pharmacy databases (e.g., Surescripts) for medication information (optional).
Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner) for integration into clinical workflows (optional).
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) with refresh tokens for secure authentication and authorization. Consider Clerk or Auth0 for simplified authentication management, especially if integrating with external systems.

technical_specifications.architecture: The system follows a microservices architecture with separate services for computer vision analysis, voice recognition, mobile app, and backend API. The frontend (mobile app) interacts with the backend API, which in turn interacts with the database, AI services, and external integrations. Edge computing will be used on the smart home device to pre-process video, minimizing latency.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions.  Leverage React Native for cross-platform mobile app development (iOS and Android).
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions.  Express.js or NestJS for building the backend API.
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes as defined in the data schema recommendations. Consider using a vector database extension like pgvector for efficient storage and querying of medication image embeddings.
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing video recordings and adherence reports.
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API for text summarization of reports, local models (CoreML, TensorFlow Lite) for edge processing on the smart home device, embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors).
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between the frontend and backend services.
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub → Vercel automatic deploy pipeline for automated deployments.

API_design: POST /api/v1/patients - Create a new patient record.
PUT /api/v1/patients/{patient_id} - Update a patient's medication schedule.
POST /api/v1/adherence_events - Create a new adherence event record.
GET /api/v1/adherence_events/{patient_id} - Retrieve a patient's adherence history.
frontend_components: Medication Schedule Management – Component for patients to set up and manage their medication schedule.
Adherence Report – Component for displaying adherence reports with visual charts and summaries.
Alerts and Notifications – Component for displaying alerts and notifications related to missed doses or incorrect medication intake.
Settings – Component for patients to configure device settings, such as voice prompt volume and caregiver contact information.

deployment_instructions: Project directory structure: /frontend (Next.js app), /backend (Node.js API), /smart-home-device (code for the smart home device).
Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID, TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN, SENDGRID_API_KEY, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY.
Vercel deployment: Deploy the frontend and backend as separate Vercel projects, linking the GitHub repositories. Configure environment variables in Vercel.
Build outputs: Frontend: Static assets for the Next.js app. Backend: Serverless functions for the API endpoints. Runtime settings: Node.js runtime for the backend.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Basic (limited features), Premium (full features), Enterprise (customizable features and support).
Usage-based pricing: Charge based on the number of active patients monitored.
Per-seat pricing: Charge per caregiver or healthcare provider accessing the platform.
Add-ons: Offer additional features, such as integration with pharmacy databases, as add-ons for an additional fee.
customer_segments: Small businesses (home healthcare agencies with a small number of patients).
Mid-market (larger home healthcare agencies and assisted living facilities).

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of active patients, number of caregivers using the platform, number of alerts sent.
AI performance KPIs: Accuracy of medication identification (object detection), accuracy of action recognition, accuracy of voice recognition.
Adoption/engagement KPIs: Patient adherence rate, caregiver engagement rate, reduction in hospital readmissions.
